quest.name: Heart of the Forest
journal: Raya–O–Senna is wearing a concerned expression.

With time running out, and yet lacking the means to complete the enchantment of your ritual garb, the Seedseer siblings have come to the decision that the three of you must attempt the Quieting nonetheless. Make for Everschade and quell the fury of the Guardian Tree.

As you begin the ritual, the great one's wrath descends upon you in the form of a bevy of enraged forest creatures. However, before all hope is lost, A–Towa–Cant himself appears from out of the aether to fight alongside you. After a grueling battle, the great mage is again forced back into his aetherial slumber, but not before entrusting the future of the Twelveswood to you and the Seedseers. With peace returned at last, return to Camp Tranquil and speak with Raya–O–Senna.

Raya–O–Senna expresses her profound gratitude for your assistance in the ritual. In recognition of your accomplishments as a white mage, she bestows upon you the last piece of your garb─now imbued with the power of the departed A–Towa–Cant─and imparts unto you the most powerful incantation she knows. Expressing her confidence that you will bring succor to the realm and do her people proud, she wishes you well in your journeys.

※The next white mage quest will be available from Raya–O–Senna once you have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”
objectives: Quell the fury of the Guardian Tree in Everschade.
Speak with Raya–O–Senna at Camp Tranquil.
Quell the great one's fury and heal the Guardian Tree!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename. Brother and I have considered every possibility, and attempted every incantation at our disposal, but I fear the task of completing the enchantment has proven beyond our abilities.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: No living Padjal─not even our sister─possesses such power. Without the blessing of A–Towa–Cant, there is nothing we can do.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: With the ashes returned to their rightful resting place, A–Towa–Cant's spirit will return. Surely, it is only a matter of time!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Look around you, Sister. Open your eyes and ears. Time is one thing we do not have.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: A–Ruhn?

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: The fury of the great one mounts with each passing moment─it will not be contained much longer. No, the time for waiting is long past. Now is the time for action.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: But...Forename's garb! The enchanting is not yet complete!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: The situation is far from ideal. Yet we have no choice─we must trust in Forename's powers and do what we can.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Do I hear you right, A–Ruhn? Why, it was not long ago that you objected to Forename's very presence at the ritual!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: I may be stubborn, Sister, but I am no fool. I have witnessed Forename's abilities with my own eyes. There can be no doubting that shehe is a mage of the white, one as worthy as you and I.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: A–Ruhn...if you would place your trust in Forename so, I see no reason why I should not. Very well, let us hasten for Everschade!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Is something the matter, Forename? This is no time to lose faith in your abilities! Hurry and take your place by the Guardian Tree!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Forename... I speak to you now as my peer. The fate of Gridania lies in the balance─we can ill afford to fail.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: The great one's rage is too strong! I cannot reach him!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Stay focused, A–Ruhn! If we fall, who will rise to take our place!?

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: But, Sister...the forest itself turns against us!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: If we can only reach the great one, his minions will relent. Cast away your worries, and focus your mind on the ritual!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: No! Forename!

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: (-???-)Stand strong, Forename! Are you going to let some overgrown shrub ruffle your feathers?

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: (-???-)And the two of you! Don't you have a ritual to perform?

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: D-Do... Do my eyes deceive me!?

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: This is no time for chitchat! Raya–O, A–Ruhn, Forename─focus your energies on the Guardian Tree!

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: We must quell the great one's fury! Dispatch its minions and resume the Quieting!

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: Now! Focus your powers on the Guardian Tree!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Is it...over?

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: The great one's anger abates. You have done well, my children.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Master A–Towa. Do you truly...live?

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: Live...? Not as you would define the word. Mayhap in the heart of Forename here, whose strength I borrowed to join you.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: It's...a miracle.

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: Aye, it may very well be. Or perhaps the Mothercrystal heard this old soul's wish...

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: I lived a long and fruitful life. But when I drew my last breath in O'Ghomoro that day, I did so with one profound regret─that I would pass from this realm without finding a worthy inheritor to bequeath my knowledge in full.

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: My spirit left my lifeless body to abide in this soul crystal, with the hope that one day it would find its way into the hands of my successor.

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: For years, my consciousness slumbered in the darkness...until I met Forename.

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: From the moment you took my crystal in hand, I knew. Padjal or no, I had at long last found one to whom I could truly pass on my knowledge.

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: Yes, Forename, I knew... Urrrgh!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Master A–Towa!?

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: The power of the crystal grows faint... It would seem my all–too–brief sojourn here has come to an end.

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: Farewell, Forename of the white. Farewell, my children. I leave my forest home in your capable hands...

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Master A–Towa... He has left us.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: And yet by his power─and that of his successor, Forename─the great one's fury is quelled, and the Twelveswood is safe.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Though Master A–Towa traveled the world, no doubt his heart always remained here. In the forest home he loved, he waited for us...

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Why, Brother...for once, you almost sound wise beyond your years.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Strange, is it not? Perhaps I have finally learned something from you, dear sister.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: As I could learn something from you, A–Ruhn. Your pride as a Padjal, your deep respect for our past─these are traits to be admired. The same can be said for Master A–Towa's liberality. Yes, I believe there is a place for both beliefs among our kind.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: The road was a long and winding one, but at long last our work is done. Let us return to Camp Tranquil.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: To meet Master A–Towa in the flesh! Well, not flesh, perhaps... I am still shaking from the experience...and from the pure joy of seeing peace return to my forest home at last.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I will be forever grateful to you, Forename. I am honored that we were able to heal the wood together.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I speak not only for myself; my brother has expressed the same sentiments. Were Master A–Towa here, I am sure he would say the same.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Though...perhaps he is still here in some form. Behold! The final piece of your garb now pulses with his ancient power.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Yes, there can be no doubt that Master A–Towa intended this as his parting gift to you.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Take it, and wear it with pride...Forename of the white.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Before we part, I would bestow unto you a present of my own.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: By the ancient powers vested in me as a Seedseer, I bestow upon you the greatest incantation known to our kind. May you ever heed the will of the elementals, and use it in wisdom and compassion.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Phew! I'm not given to formalities. I swear, I do not know how my sister manages...

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: In the short time I have known you, Forename, you have grown into a fine white mage. I am honored to call you my peer. Use your powers in moderation, and let compassion be your guide, and I have no doubt that you will bring succor and solace wherever your journey takes you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the white mage quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next white mage quest will be available from Raya–O–Senna.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
The great one is consumed by grief and anger.
Our words will not reach him in this state.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Fear not, my children─I will protect you.
Focus your energies on the Quieting!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Out of my way, foul creature!
I cannot concentrate on the ritual!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
That's the spirit, my children!
I feel the great one responding...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No! It can't...end like this...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Sister... Forgive me...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
My strength grows dim, my children...
I must...return...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
We must quell the great one's fury!
Focus on the Guardian Tree!
